chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq ", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines: Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts. Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'. Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary. Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided. Example 1: Hypotheses: n, m: nat IHn: m + n = n + m Goal: m + S n = S n + m Proof: ```coq simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto. Qed.``` Example 2: Hypotheses: Goal: forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m ```coq intros n m. induction n. - simpl. auto. - simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto. Qed.``` Solve This Proof State: Hypotheses: X: Type m: list X l: list X Goal: list_has_dup l -> list_has_dup (l ++ m) Premises: Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename Inductive list_has_dup : list X -> Prop := in_list_hd0 : forall l (x : X), In x l -> list_has_dup (x :: l) | in_list_hd1 : forall l (x : X), list_has_dup l -> list_has_dup (x :: l) Arguments list_has_dup _%list_scope Arguments in_list_hd0 _%list_scope Arguments in_list_hd1 [l]%list_scope list_has_dup_app_left : forall l m, list_has_dup m -> list_has_dup (l ++ m) in_list_hd1 : forall l (x : X), list_has_dup l -> list_has_dup (x :: l) list_has_dup_cons_inv : forall (x : X) l, list_has_dup (x :: l) -> In x l \/ list_has_dup l list_hd_cons_inv : forall (x : X) l, list_has_dup (x :: l) -> In x l \/ list_has_dup l list_has_dup_sind : forall P : list X -> SProp, (forall l (x : X), In x l -> P (x :: l)) -> (forall l (x : X), list_has_dup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l, list_has_dup l -> P l list_has_dup_ind : forall P : list X -> Prop, (forall l (x : X), In x l -> P (x :: l)) -> (forall l (x : X), list_has_dup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l, list_has_dup l -> P l in_list_hd0 : forall l (x : X), In x l -> list_has_dup (x :: l) incl_app : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl m n -> incl (l ++ m) n incl_appl : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl l (n ++ m) in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a (l ++ m) -> In a l \/ In a m in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a l \/ In a m -> In a (l ++ m) incl_cons_linv : forall (X : Type) (l m : list X) (x : X), incl (x :: m) l -> In x l /\ incl m l app_assoc_reverse : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), (l ++ m) ++ n = l ++ m ++ n app_assoc : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), l ++ m ++ n = (l ++ m) ++ n Forall2_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (x : X) (l : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: m) < -> R x y /\ Forall2 R l m Znat.Nat2Z.inj_add : forall n m : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (n + m) = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.of_nat n) (BinInt.Z.of_nat m) prefix_rect : forall (X : Type) (P : list X -> list X -> Type), (forall ll : list X, P nil ll) -> (forall (x : X) (l ll : list X), l

P l ll -> P (x :: l) (x :: ll)) -> forall l ll : list X, l

P l ll Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0 list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l list_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Type), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l Add_ind : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall l : list A, P l (a :: l)) -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), Add a l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> forall l l0 : list A, Add a l l0 -> P l l0 Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), clos_refl A leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Desc A leA l -> P l Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), clos_refl A leA x y -> Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Desc A leA l -> P l Permutation_transp_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), (forall l : list A, P l l) -> (forall (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), P (l1 ++ y :: x :: l2) (l1 ++ x :: y :: l2)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, Permutation_transp l l' -> P l l' -> Permutation_transp l' l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, Permutation_transp l l0 -> P l l0 Permutation_transp_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall l : list A, P l l) -> (forall (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), P (l1 ++ y :: x :: l2) (l1 ++ x :: y :: l2)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, Permutation_transp l l' -> P l l' -> Permutation_transp l' l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, Permutation_transp l l0 -> P l l0 Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l : list X) (m1 m2 : list Y), Forall2 R l (m1 ++ m2) -> {l1 : list X & {l2 : list X | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ l = l1 ++ l2}} List.Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (l1' l2' : list B) (l : list A), Forall2 R l (l1' ++ l2') -> exists l1 l2 : list A, Forall2 R l1 l1' /\ Forall2 R l2 l2' /\ l = l1 ++ l2 flat_map : forall A B : Type, (A -> list B) -> list A -> list B Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope prefix_spec : forall (X : Type) (l ll : list X), l

{r : list X | ll = l ++ r}
